Name: Susan Backes
Bio: I’m Susan Backes, a longtime Rice University neighbor.  Since the 1980’s I have had a private practice of psychiatry and an avocation of photography.  My study with Rice’s Peter Brown has fueled that passion, especially portrait and street photography.  My other free time is spent with my dock-diving/frisbee-playing golden doodle puppy.  I look forward to being a community associate at Will Rice College and cheering on the winningest team!

Name: Gisela & Igor Cherches
Job: Community Relations Manager, St. John's School (Gisela)
Bio: Gisela Cherches works on the Advancement Team at St. John’s School, a prominent Houston preparatory school.  She is a Will Rice (’85) alum who enjoys art galleries and travel in her spare time.  Igor (SRC ’86), is a neurologist who emigrated from Belarus as a teenager and whose hobbies include biking and martial arts.  Igor received his medical degree from the Baylor College of Medicine and is now affiliated with both Baylor St. Luke’s Medical Center and Houston Methodist Hospital.

Name: Clint Corcoran & Rachel Mis
Second Job: PhD Student in Clinical Psychology, Temple University (Rachel)
Bio: Clint Corcoran (WRC ‘07) works as a Director in investment banking at RBC Capital Markets, with a focus on energy finance. He loves his wife Rachel, sports, traveling, math, ancient civilizations, grammar, cheese, and all things Will Rice. Rachel Mis (WRC ‘10) is a doctoral student in Clinical Psychology at Temple University in Philadelphia, PA, specializing in the neuropsychology of aging and dementia. Between classes, research, and working in a hospital, she finds time to play with her cat (Minnie), travel, sample chocolates, and go to barre classes. Oh, and spend time with Clint in Philadelphia, Houston, and other places around the world! She is always happy to speak with any Will Ricers interested in graduate school in psychology or related fields.

Name: Andrea & Chris Ehlers
Bio: Andrea and Chis Ehlers are both proud Will Rice alums who were very involved in the college when they were students and who have now been active Associates for over two decades.  Andrea, a former O-Week Coordinator, has worked for PeopleSoft and WorkDay, and now does software support for HISD.  She reads 2-4 books per week, so she’ll always have something to talk with you about!  Chris, a former Rice swimmer and MechE, uses his spare time to attend Deutsche Samstagsschule (German Saturday School) and mentor the robotics team at Carnegie Vanguard High School.

Name: Kraig & Maryann Grahmann
Second Job: Attorney, formerly at Sidley Austin LLP (Maryann)
Bio: Kraig and Maryann Grahmann met at Rice in 2003, when Kraig was a sophomore at Martel and Maryann was a freshman at Will Rice.  Kraig graduated from Rice in 2005 and went to the University of Houston Law Center.  Maryann graduated from Rice in 2006 and went to Yale Law School.  They got married in 2009.  After law school, Kraig started working at Haynes and Boone, LLP.  Kraig now is a partner in the Energy Practice Group, and is the head of the firm's Energy Finance Practice Group.  After law school, Maryann worked at Mayer Brown LLP and then Sidley Austin LLP, practicing complex commercial litigation and representing Latin American companies doing business in the U.S.  The Grahmanns have 3 awesome little kids.

Name: Manu Gupta
Bio: I am the Managing Director of Indus Management Group.  We are a property and asset management company that specializes in the multifamily housing market. IMG has a portfolio of 21 apartment complexes consisting of approximately 6000 apartment units in the Houston market, specifically specializing in the Southwest Houston sub-market.  I graduated from Rice in 2005 with a BA in History, and got an MD in 2011.  I opted out of going to residency and made a career switch, taking me to where I am now.  My favorite thing to do on a Saturday morning is to play video games.  I build my own gaming computers and I might have a slight obsession with board games as well.  Some of my favorite are Pandemic, Clank!, and Machi Koro.

Name: Bill & Lucila Haase
Bio: Bill Haase is a young, 76-year-old, opera-loving bicyclist.  A WRC ’63 alum, he studied Chemical Engineering at Rice, then went on to receive an M.S. in Mathematics from U of H.  He worked for Mars, Inc., in a range of positions, including logistics, finance, personnel, Cocoa futures trading, and Cocoa crop research.  Now retired, he is an enthusiastic foodie, Houston tour guide, and trivia competitor.  Lucila Haase enjoys any and all performing arts.  She loves anything to do with medicine and enjoys mentoring and interacting with high school and college students.  Lucila is a retired college instructor/counselor and American Cancer Society volunteer trainer, and she is currently a liaison volunteer at M. D. Anderson.  Lucila is originally from Buenos Aires, Argentina.

Name: Michelle Hicks
Bio: Michelle Hicks graduated from Rice in 1987 (B.A., English and History) and went to law school in Austin (The University of Texas School of Law, J.D. 1990).  She has worked primarily in the energy industry in Houston, including with Vinson & Elkins and Enron, and she has been with Exelon/Constellation for 15 years.  Michelle's interests include cheering for Rice student-athletes, traveling (including Cuba with the Rice baseball team in 2016) and attending Broadway musicals.

Name: Christopher Hui
Job: Youth Soccer Coach, Soccer Shots Houston
Bio: I moved to Houston in 2018 from Naperville, IL, a Chicago suburb. I graduated with a B.S. in Psychology and Religious Studies from the University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign in 2017. During undergrad, I was a Resident Advisor for five semesters and spent my last semester studying abroad in Rwanda. I currently work for Soccer Shots Houston as a Youth Soccer Coach, going to various schools, churches, daycares, and preschools across the greater Houston area to teach soccer and character development for 2- to 8-year-olds. My long-term dream is to attend seminary and become a pastor. In my spare time, I love playing and watching sports, being outdoors, playing musical instruments, and watching Netflix!

Name: Isabelle & Jeff Jeffress
Bio: Isabelle (Hubert) Jeffress (WRC ’91) and Jeff Jeffress (WRC ’91) met on their first day at WRC in the (now replaced) new dorm.  Isabelle went on to graduate from the UTHSC – Houston and is a dual boarded physician in internal medicine and pediatrics.  She owns and runs her own practice, Pear Tree Medical Associates in Pearland. Jeff works for BMC Software, where he trains sales people and engineers in technology and sales techniques. The Jeffresses eat, sleep, and breathe Beer Bike!

Name: Christopher Kilgore
Bio: Christopher Kilgore specializes in art-historical analysis, but he has also had a fascinating range of other jobs, including owning his own film production company and being an instructor of Chinese martial arts.  A Will Rice (’80) alum and former WRC president, he earned two Bachelor’s Degrees at Rice and recently went back to school to earn an M.A. in Art History from the University of Houston.  Chris was chosen to be "Mr. Mensa" in 2018!

Name: David & Mary Klein
Second Job: Contract Quality Review Nurse, UT Austin School of Nursing (Mary)
Bio: David Klein is a native Houstonian and proud Will Rice (’72) alum.  He has had a long and successful career in real estate and venture capital, and currently works as Owner and CEO of Klein Equities.  David also serves on the Board of Directors for the Boy Scouts of America, numerous boards supporting education and literacy, and the Jones Business School’s Council of Advisors.  His hobbies include racquetball, mountain hiking, and botany.  Mary Klein received her Master’s degree as a Registered Nurse from UT-Houston School of Nursing.  She specializes in geriatric nursing and participates in the UT Health Consortium on Aging, as well as the Foundation Board for the Society of Otorhinolaryngology and Head/Neck Nurses.  In her spare time, Mary enjoys reading, adventure hiking, playing the dulcimer, and spending time with family.  David and Mary are the parents of Shannon Klein (WRC ’19).

Name: Eastman & Alyson Landry
Bio: Eastman Landry (WRC '09) earned a B.S. in Mechanical Engineering at Rice and a M.Ed. in Curriculum and Instruction at the University of Houston. He is currently a physics and mathematics teacher at the Kinder High School for the Performing and Visual Arts (HSPVA) and can be seen on the Rice campus over the summer as the Physics Instructor for RESP. He is married to Alyson Landry, who attended Florida State University and has her Masters in Arts Leadership from the University of Houston. She also works at HSPVA as the Senior Capstone teacher. The Landrys enjoy cooking, traveling, playing with their dog Myles, and as of 2018 exploring parenting with their baby daughter Evelyn. If you have any teaching/education related questions, please do not hesitate to contact them!

Name: Aniruddha & Ritu Patel
Second Job: Healthcare Administrator, Baylor College of Medicine (Ritu)
Bio: Aniruddha Patel (WRC ’03) is a Cardiothoracic Anesthesiologist.  Ritu Patel is an Assistant Director at Baylor College of Medicine.  In their spare time, they love to travel and see the world.  They enjoy being outdoors, hiking, biking, and working out.

Name: Arthur & Karen Rogers
Bio: Arthur Rogers is a retired partner with the law firm of Fulbright and Jaworski (now Norton Rose Fulbright). He has been a long-time member of the Board of Trustees at the Alley Theatre. Karen served as a member of the Rice Board of Trustees at Rice from 2000 to 2004. She is a co-author of Rice University: One Hundred Years in Pictures. She also serves on the Women's Athletic Advisory Board and the board of the Society of Rice University Women. They have been community associates at Will Rice since 1972.

Name: Cody & Tanvi Sharma
Job: Dean of High School, Chinquapin Preparatory School (Cody)
Bio: Cody and Tanvi Sharma are Will Rice alums from 2013. Cody, who graduated as a Poli Sci major, works as a dean of high school and teacher at Chinquapin Preparatory School. Tanvi was an Archi and works in architecture and urban design at Huitt-Zollars. Cody spends his free time playing video games, re-watching Star Trek, and reading every non-fiction history book out there. Tanvi spends her free time dancing, doing photography, or trying to show Cody Bollywood movies. They both love traveling and spend all their vacation trying to see as much of the world as possible!

Name: Charles "Kin" Spain
Job: Justice, Court of Appeals for the Fourteenth District of Texas
Bio: Charles “Kin” Spain (WRC ‘81) is a lawyer who worked for the Texas appellate courts for 23 years as a staff attorney and served as a City of Houston municipal court judge from 2010 until he was elected in 2018 as a justice on the Fourteenth Court of Appeals. He is a co-founder of the LGBT Law Section of the State Bar of Texas, the first LGBT section in the United States of a mandatory bar. He is the Scoutmaster of Troop 511 across Main Street at Palmer Memorial Episcopal Church. His hobby is vexillology, the study of flags. Kin’s husband, John Adcock, is a civil appellate lawyer at Beck Redden LLP.

Name: Dawn Stuckey
Bio: Dawn Stuckey has worked as an athletic trainer at Houston Methodist Hospital since April 2018.  Her main responsibility/assignment is to take care of Rice athletics and aid in scheduling physician and imaging appointments.  Previously, Dawn worked as an athletic trainer at Rice for 13 years, and the University still holds a special place in her heart.  Outside of work, she enjoys teaching spin classes at the Rec Center and competing in triathlons of every distance.  Dawn also loves to mentor, so feel free to contact her if you are interested in a medical profession.

Name: Bill & Jean Tanner
Bio: Born at a young age, Bill Tanner came to Rice in 1990 and graduated with a BS in Mechanical Engineering in '94.  In order to avoid the real world a bit longer, he stuck around to earn his Masters in Mechanical Engineering in '95.  During his time at Rice he was involved in the Cascade Juggling Club, KTRU, the Mob, and the Rice Players (among other things).  He always meant to do a comic strip for the Thresher, but settled on doing t-shirt designs and even came up with the 90's re-design of Sammy the Owl.  He currently works at Schlumberger as a Solution Architect and enjoys drawing, playing ukulele, and spending time with his family in his spare time.  He was lucky enough to meet his wife Jean (Hanszen '88) after they both had been out of Rice for a while, so they're doing their part to prop up that particular myth.

Name: Isabel Valdez
Bio: I'm a proud WRC alum from the Class of 2001.  I loved my days at WRC as a student, having served as an O-week Advisor, Beer Bike Coordinator, Associates Committee member and loads more. I've come full circle because I'm now serving as an Associate and want to do so much more! Since 2009 (the same amount of years that I've been an Associate), I've been working at Baylor College of Medicine as a Physician Assistant; I see patients and teach students at Baylor. I'm always excited to chat it up with our WRCers so if you don't see me at an Associates' event, you can catch me at WRC Commons when I take a break from my jogs at 5:30 AM on weekdays (YIKES!) or weekends before 10:00 AM.  WRWS!

Name: Albert Wei
Bio: I am a proud Will Rice Alum, class of 2012! I served as an RHA for two years and the Chief Justice my senior year. I founded Karma Patrol along with a great team of WRC RHA's. After graduating, I jumped into Teach for America and now work in education tech, designing software that helps care coordinators connect students to holistic supports. You can always find me watching “Friends” reruns or debating with myself on whether I'll make it to the gym to swim laps. I usually end up watching “Friends” reruns.

Name: E. Neely Atkinson
Bio: Neely Atkinson worked for M.D. Anderson Cancer Center for 35 years, focusing primarily on statistical algorithms and early detection of cervical and ovarian cancer.  Since retiring in 2010, he joined the Rice faculty and is now a Senior Lecturer in Statistics.  He has a B.A. in English (WRC ’75) and a Ph.D. in Mathematical Sciences from Rice, and he ran the Rice aikido club while in graduate school.  Neely is active in the Houston Folk Music Society, the Houston Zen Center, and the Houston Bicycle Club, and he has toured several countries and states on bicycle.

Name: Michele Biavati & Maria Bejan
Bio: Michele Biavati and Maria Bejan are both Senior Lecturers in the Economics Department.  Michele is originally from Italy and Maria from Romania, and they met while working on their PhDs in Madrid, Spain.  Maria also studied in Milan and Florence, Italy, and Michele in London, UK, and they both spent several years in Mexico City—so it’s no surprise that these two continue to enjoy traveling and exploring different cultures together!  Besides travel, Michele enjoys biking, reading, and cooking.  Maria likes photography, dancing, and eating the food cooked by Michele.

Name: Gwen Bradford
Bio: Gwen Bradford is a professor of Philosophy whose research interests include value theory, achievement, and perfectionism.  Gwen served as a Will Rice Resident Associate from 2015 to 2018, so she feels closely tied to the college and its students.  In her spare time, Gwen enjoys jogging, coffee-shop hopping, and exploring Houston’s arts opportunities, as well as walking her perfect bulldog, Dozer.

Name: Divya Chaudhry
Job: Lecturer, Center for Languages and Intercultural Communication
Bio: My name is Divya Chaudhry, and I teach Hindi at Rice's Center for Languages and Intercultural Communication (CLIC). I joined Rice in 2016. I originally moved to the United States from New Delhi, India, in 2011 to pursue my Ph.D. in linguistics at the University of Florida (UF), Gainesville. I have taught Hindi at UF and University of Wisconsin-Madison. I have also taught English as a second language at UF’s intensive English program. My research interests include conversation analysis, second language acquisition and pedagogy, and language teacher professional development.  I enjoy reading, biking, stand-up comedy, and street theater (known as ‘nukkad naatak’ in Hindi). I also absolutely love ‘bhangra’ (a traditional Indian folk dance), Bollywood dancing, and everything Harry Potter.

Name: Dan Cohan
Bio: Dan Cohan is an Associate Professor of Civil and Environmental Engineering focusing on air pollution, climate change, and energy.  Beyond the typical teaching and research, you may occasionally spot his op-eds in the Houston Chronicle or The Hill, or hear him weigh in on environmental issues on NPR.  He is also working on his first book, on efforts to address climate change.

Name: Marya Cokar
Bio: Marya Cokar is a lecturer in the CHBE department at Rice University and she has been working here for over 4 years.  She has a PhD in Chemical Engineering from the University of Calgary.  Her main interests are biogenic methane generation and water purification.  She is also an academic advisor in the CHBE department and loves working with the students to help them with academic and career advising.  She is currently teaching several courses in the department and is responsible for the department’s accreditation needs as well.  She enjoys the outdoors, especially gardening, hiking, and biking.  If you want to meet Marya, just join her at the lunch table at Will Rice or send her an email!

Name: Helge Gonnermann
Bio: Helge Gonnermann is a professor of Earth Science who specializes in volcanic and magmatic processes.

Name: Bridget Gorman & Mike Reed
Job: Dean of Undergraduates, Professor of Sociology (Bridget)
Second Job: Owner, Party dance floor rental company (Mike)
Bio: Bridget Gorman and Mike Reed were the Magisters of Will Rice College for seven years, from 2011-2018.  Their daughter, Frances (“Frankie”), was born while they were living at Will Rice, in 2014.  They love music, tennis, cheering on the Astros, and exploring restaurants in Houston.

Name: Alma Novotny
Bio: Alma Novotny joined Will Rice as a Faculty Associate in 2006 after Mike Gustin and Mike Wolf worked a trade to get more science faculty.  She teaches Immunology in BioSciences and writes many letters of recommendation. Her first visit to Will Rice resulted in her getting hit in the forehead with a paper airplane, and she knew she had come to the right place. Settling in, she became a Divisional Advisor and dragged her husband, Edward, into the fray as well.  He’s a retired engineer from Exxon Mobil and has volunteered at the Houston Zoo for over 20 years, where he announces sea lion shows and is certified to present the porcupine.  Together they are avid supporters of Will Rice’s artistic and community projects.  They also supply a seven-layer dip for every semester’s Associate Study Break.

Name: Hesam Panahi
Job: Lecturer, Jones Graduate School of Business
Bio: Hesam Panahi is a Lecturer in Entrepreneurship at Rice’s Jones Business School and the Liu Idea Lab for Innovation and Entrepreneurship, where he teaches undergraduate and graduate courses in entrepreneurship and design thinking.  He was born and raised in Houston, TX.  When he’s not at Rice, Hesam enjoys spending time with his family.

Name: Dale & Elise Sawyer
Bio: Dale and Elise arrived at Rice in 1988, and became associates soon afterward. Dale is a (retired) professor of geophysics, studying plate tectonics and earthquakes. His last project was 3D seismic imaging off the coast of Vigo, Spain. Elise is a retired kindergarten teacher and (dabbling on the dark side - administration) an International Baccalaureate/STEM magnet coordinator in HISD. They served as Magisters of WRC, 1997-2002 and SRC, 2009-2014.

Name: Sebastian Schmidt
Job: Postdoctoral Fellow, Rice Academy of Fellows
Bio: I am a postdoctoral fellow in the Academy of Fellows here at Rice. I completed a PhD in the history and theory of architecture at MIT, where I also served as a resident tutor in an undergrad dorm for six years. I study the relationship between war, violence, and cities in the 20th century, with a focus on global and racial ideologies. I have lived and studied in Germany, New Zealand, Scotland, England, as well as Japan, where I was working as a ski instructor when I decided to go to grad school (life works in mysterious ways sometimes). I ride my bike as much as I can, and generally like being active—going for long walks/hikes, hot yoga, and skating around the bayou are some favorites. Given my field of study, I really love art, architecture, and travel. I’ve also spent many years talking with students about grad school and career choices, so don’t be shy and reach out if you ever need a sounding board. I look forward to being a resource to Will Rice!

Name: Aliya Bhimani
Bio: Aliya Bhimani is the Director of Academic Advising in the Office of Academic Advising (OAA). In the OAA she leads a team of academic and athletic advisors that help students navigate their academic college experience. The OAA does everything from educating the community about academic rules and regulations, training and managing programs like the Peer Academic Advisors, and meeting one-on-one with students that are considering their academic goals, whether it be course selection, resources, applying to medical school, or beyond. Aliya was born and raised in College Station, Texas, but her family is originally from Nairobi, Kenya. She joined Rice in 2013, after spending almost a decade in Washington DC. Aliya has a BS in Communication Studies from The University of Texas at Austin, as well as a MA in Education and Human Development from The George Washington University. Aliya loves to travel, read, and watch and play tennis.

Name: Kevin Kirby
Bio: Kevin Kirby is the Vice President for Administration at Rice University.  Prior to joining Rice, Dr. Kirby was the Chief Operating Officer for the Columbia University Medical Center; served as Executive Officer for the National Institute of Neurological Disorders and Stroke at the National Institutes of Health; held several management positions with the Army Research Laboratory; served on the staff of the White House Office of Science and Technology Policy; served as science adviser for the Commanding General, Army Forces Command; and started his career conducting research on the low temperature behavior of materials at the Army Materials Technology Lab.  In addition to his administrative responsibilities, he teaches two undergraduate classes – Leadership in Higher Education and Crisis Leadership.  Kevin holds a B.S. in chemical engineering from Syracuse University, an M.S. in management from MIT, another master’s degree in social and organizational learning from George Mason University, and a doctorate in higher education from the University of Pennsylvania.  He is married to Caroline Levander who is the Carlson Professor of Humanities and English at Rice.

Name: Ivette Mekdessi
Job: Assistant Director, Center for Career Development
Bio: Ivette Mekdessi has been a career counselor at the Center for Career Development (CCD) for 3+ years, where she collaborates with students in exploring their interests, abilities, values, and goals as they relate to the world of work and career development through 1-on-1 appointments, workshops, and events. She looks forward to empowering YOU to make optimal career, educational, and life decisions.  Having conducted research in varying fields of psychology, including job satisfaction, employee well-being, and stress overflow, she wants to help you make the most of your time at WRC. Ivette also looks forward to sharing her international perspective and her passion for travel and exploring new cultures, having attended and worked in international schools her entire life, speaking 4 languages (English, Spanish, French, and Arabic), and having visited 43 countries. A native Houstonian and avid foodie, she also looks forward to exchanging restaurant recommendations and staycation ideas with you.

Name: Ken Nipe
Bio: Officer Nipe has worked at Rice for nearly 40 years and has many tales to tell of student escapades that tested (or overtly crossed) the legal line!  One of his specialties has been student self-defense, and he has worked particularly hard on implementing programs to empower women and give them skills to protect themselves.  In addition to serving on security detail for some high-profile visitors here on campus, Nipe also worked as a security volunteer at multiple Olympics.  Officer Nipe eats lunch in the college several days a week, so pull up a chair and ask him about some of his interesting experiences.

Name: Anne & Gregg Walker
Job: Executive Director, University Financial Aid Services (Anne)
Bio: Anne Walker works in the Office of Enrollment at Rice where she is the Executive Director of Financial Aid Services.  Her husband Gregg has worked at Nalco Water for over thirty years and is currently a Senior Account Manger there.  Anne and Gregg are devoted outdoor enthusiasts, spending their recreational time fishing on their boat, hunting, and playing or watching sports.
